title: The 5 Best Hair Trends From the Spring/Summer 2025 Runways to Try ASAP
description: The dirtier the hair, the better!
excerpt: The dirtier the hair, the better!
text: As beauty editors, Fashion Month isn’t about the clothes for us. It’s more of a way to look into the proverbial crystal ball and see what beauty trends might lie in our future. Last year, during the spring/summer ’25 shows, we oohed and aahed over the makeup trends and nail trends we saw populate the runways. However, what truly captured our attention were the hair looks we believe will be everywhere once the weather begins to warm up.For example, we predict that sculptural updos, à la the modern update of the timeless French roll at LaQuan Smith, may be en vogue come spring. If you have an affinity for a more effortless vibe, try looking at Collina Strada’s cascading waves or Grace Ling, Tibi, and Wiederhoeft’s indie sleaze-inspired styles for inspiration. Below, see some snapshots of the aforementioned spring/summer hair trends and more to get a head start on next season’s hair refresh.Distressed HairWhat if we told you this season’s hack to a chic look is simply skipping wash day? The recent indie sleaze trend has been at the forefront of fashion and is going strong in the beauty world. According to the spring/summer ’25 runways, the key to looking put together is to look like you don’t care too much at all. Grace Ling, Tibi, and Wiederhoeft were just a few of the designers who leaned into the unkempt, distressed, almost dirty-looking hair. At Wiederhoeft, Oribe’s principal artist, Kien Hoang, used Straight Away Smoothing Blowout Cream and Après Beach Wave and Shine Spray to create the messy look without compromising on shine.Oribe Straight Away Smoothing Blowout Hair CreamOribe Apres Beach Wave and Shine SprayCrown Affair The Flexible Hold Finishing Hair GelSculptural SleekNo matter the season, you can never go wrong with an updo. Designers urged onlookers to elevate their look by adding a sculptural element. You can go a bit more avant-garde, like Evanie Frausto’s artistic take on a classic bun at Luar. Or, you can also try a French roll to recreate the slick updos at LaQuan Smith, created by celebrity hairstylist Lurissa Ingrid.Tresemmé Mega Control Sculpting Gel Tresemmé Keratin Smooth Weightless Silky Shine Hair SprayNow 13% OffCamille Rose Aloe Whipped Butter GelUnusual EmbellishmentsIf this season’s hair looks prove one thing, it’s that the more playful the style, the better. Last year, we saw hair embellishments in the form of golden flecks and ribbons. This time around, designers are incorporating diamond and pearl-encrusted barrettes, metallic floral pins, and hair clips that cascade down the length of your hair.Chopova Lowena Black Flower HeadbandSimone Rocha Silver & Pink Carnation Hair ClipSimone Rocha Silver Mini Flower Hair ClipBangs, Bangs, BangsSabrina Carpenter would be happy to know that a perfectly quaffed bang is one of the season’s hottest hair trends. From thick bangs paired with bob haircuts at Christian Cowan to the side-swept wispy bangs at Sergio Hudson and Tibi, there’s no coincidence that bangs are having a moment. Living Proof No Frizz Smooth Styling Spray Ghd Duet Blowdry-Hair Dryer BrushMoroccanoil Perfect Defense Heat ProtectantRapunzel Waves The theme of Collina Strada’s spring/summer collection was “Touch Grass,” so it was no surprise that the models’ hair nearly grazed the ground. The show aimed to embody ease and find peace amidst chaos, and the long, wavy hairstyles added a breezy elegance to the story. Models at Di Pesta also sported long beachy waves, in line with the show’s celebration of the beauty and power of womanhood. The flowy style exuded a graceful sophistication and effortless charm, a recurring theme on the 2025 spring/summer runways.Amika High Tide Deep Wave Hair CrimperCrown Affair The Finishing Hair Spray Oribe Gold Lust Dry Heat Protection Spray
html:
As beauty editors, Fashion Month isn’t about the clothes for us. It’s more of a way to look into the proverbial crystal ball and see what beauty trends might lie in our future. Last year, during the spring/summer ’25 shows, we oohed and aahed over the makeup trends and nail trends we saw populate the runways. However, what truly captured our attention were the hair looks we believe will be everywhere once the weather begins to warm up.

For example, we predict that sculptural updos, à la the modern update of the timeless French roll at LaQuan Smith, may be en vogue come spring. If you have an affinity for a more effortless vibe, try looking at Collina Strada’s cascading waves or Grace Ling, Tibi, and Wiederhoeft’s indie sleaze-inspired styles for inspiration. Below, see some snapshots of the aforementioned spring/summer hair trends and more to get a head start on next season’s hair refresh.

Distressed Hair

What if we told you this season’s hack to a chic look is simply skipping wash day? The recent indie sleaze trend has been at the forefront of fashion and is going strong in the beauty world. According to the spring/summer ’25 runways, the key to looking put together is to look like you don’t care too much at all. Grace Ling, Tibi, and Wiederhoeft were just a few of the designers who leaned into the unkempt, distressed, almost dirty-looking hair. At Wiederhoeft, Oribe’s principal artist, Kien Hoang, used Straight Away Smoothing Blowout Cream and Après Beach Wave and Shine Spray to create the messy look without compromising on shine.

Oribe Straight Away Smoothing Blowout Hair Cream

Oribe Apres Beach Wave and Shine Spray

Crown Affair The Flexible Hold Finishing Hair Gel

Sculptural Sleek

No matter the season, you can never go wrong with an updo. Designers urged onlookers to elevate their look by adding a sculptural element. You can go a bit more avant-garde, like Evanie Frausto’s artistic take on a classic bun at Luar. Or, you can also try a French roll to recreate the slick updos at LaQuan Smith, created by celebrity hairstylist Lurissa Ingrid.

Tresemmé Mega Control Sculpting Gel

Tresemmé Keratin Smooth Weightless Silky Shine Hair Spray

Now 13% Off

Camille Rose Aloe Whipped Butter Gel

Unusual Embellishments

If this season’s hair looks prove one thing, it’s that the more playful the style, the better. Last year, we saw hair embellishments in the form of golden flecks and ribbons. This time around, designers are incorporating diamond and pearl-encrusted barrettes, metallic floral pins, and hair clips that cascade down the length of your hair.

Chopova Lowena Black Flower Headband

Simone Rocha Silver & Pink Carnation Hair Clip

Simone Rocha Silver Mini Flower Hair Clip

Bangs, Bangs, Bangs

Sabrina Carpenter would be happy to know that a perfectly quaffed bang is one of the season’s hottest hair trends. From thick bangs paired with bob haircuts at Christian Cowan to the side-swept wispy bangs at Sergio Hudson and Tibi, there’s no coincidence that bangs are having a moment.

Living Proof No Frizz Smooth Styling Spray

Ghd Duet Blowdry-Hair Dryer Brush

Moroccanoil Perfect Defense Heat Protectant

Rapunzel Waves

The theme of Collina Strada’s spring/summer collection was “Touch Grass,” so it was no surprise that the models’ hair nearly grazed the ground. The show aimed to embody ease and find peace amidst chaos, and the long, wavy hairstyles added a breezy elegance to the story. Models at Di Pesta also sported long beachy waves, in line with the show’s celebration of the beauty and power of womanhood. The flowy style exuded a graceful sophistication and effortless charm, a recurring theme on the 2025 spring/summer runways.

Amika High Tide Deep Wave Hair Crimper

Crown Affair The Finishing Hair Spray

Oribe Gold Lust Dry Heat Protection Spray
